narrative.title: 2Nd Armored Division - 1943Q1
narrative.situation: American Armored Division (Heavy) deployed in North Africa during 1943Q1.
narrative.objectives: Armored exploitation and breakthrough force in training for amphibious operations. Heavy armored division retained 18 tank companies providing superior tank strength. Primary focus during 1943-Q1 was preparation for Sicily invasion (Operation Husky) through intensive amphibious training with Fifth Army.
narrative.axis_objective: Hold current positions and prevent Allied breakthrough.
narrative.allied_objective: Advance and neutralize Axis defensive positions.

weather.terrain: Moroccan coastal plains, Spanish Morocco frontier training areas. Mix of coastal terrain and inland hills used for amphibious assault training and maneuver exercises.

air_support.note: No theater air summary available for this quarter

special_rules: Heavy division structure: Two armored regiments with 18 total tank companies
Combat Command structure allows flexible combined arms task organization
Amphibious training: Intensive preparation for beach landings in Sicily
Self-propelled artillery maintains pace with armored advance
Mechanized infantry provides immediate infantry support
Elements deployable to Tunisia while main body trains
